summary: This document is an email chain from March 2020 discussing evidence related to the Epstein case, specifically referencing evidence item 1B5 from a 2005 trash pull by PBPD (Palm Beach Police Department). The correspondence involves Assistant United States Attorneys from the Southern District of New York seeking clarification on the source and voucher status of certain printed messages.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Correspondent in the email chain discussing evidence from the Epstein investigation, working in the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Evidence packaging from trash pull
events.description: Evidence item 1B5 was packaged by PBPD (Palm Beach Police Department) after being seized from a trash pull.

events.title: Discovery of printed messages
events.description: An individual located and identified print-out messages that appear to have been seized during a search warrant or trash pulls in the Epstein investigation.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Evidence item 1B5 was seized from a trash pull and packaged by PBPD on April 11, 2005.
The correspondence discusses printed messages that appear to be evidence seized during search warrants or trash pulls in the Epstein investigation.
Prosecutors from the Southern District of New York were seeking to verify if these messages were properly itemized as voucher items in the FBI's system.
The email chain spans from April 2019 to March 2020, showing ongoing evidence review and clarification efforts.
